title.value: Viability assessment of the young sturgeon grown in the closed water supply installations of Belarus
Оценка жизнестойкости молоди осетровых рыб, выращенных в установках замкнутого водоснабжения Беларуси

journal.title: Belarus Fish Industry Problems : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Rogovtsov, S.V., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)
Barulin, N.V., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)

abstract.value: The article contains viability assessment research data of young sturgeon grown in a closed water system. For experimental evaluation of the viability level of young sturgeon species the following express-tests have been used: assessment of the physiological status of the fish, ecological and physiological method of functional loads, histophysiological and biochemical techniques, behavioral models, neuro-pharmacological testing. The studies reveal that young sturgeon grown in closed water supply conditions is characterized by higher viability values to extreme factors of the water environment, such as the lack of oxygen, high water temperatures and prolonged lack of food if compared to the young specimen grown at natural temperature and water conditions. However, the young specimen grown in the closed water supply conditions have violations observed in behavioral and adaptive tests, suggesting the inferiority of the grown young species in respect to the normal functioning of all regulation system components.
